title: SERIF FONT for BE INSPIRED
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404062309im_/http:/typophile.com/files/zfont_6299.jpg)

Please ID. Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [zfont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404062309/http:/typophile.com/files/zfont.jpg) | 50.6 KB |
author: mkstudio

comments.content:
That’s [Belgrano](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404062309/https:/www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Belgrano) (available via Google Fonts).

Here’s one handy thing to know: If you want to identify a webfont, you can select the text that uses it, right-click on your selection and then select ‘Inspect Element’ from the context menu (in Firefox and Chrome). The font name will be shown on the right-hand side in the panel at the bottom of the screen. You might want to click on the tab ‘Fonts’ in Firefox or ‘Computed’ in Chrome for a neater overview.

Couldn't have explained it a better way than R. did (and will probably quote it in the future).  
Other handy option for Chrome user only: Chrome [WhatFont](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404062309/http:/chengyinliu.com/whatfont.html) app by Chengyin Liu. Click the toolbar app icon and simply hover html text to reveal the webfont name.
